DataElement.preferredName: Ascites Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that ascites is present as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ascites Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.  The fluid may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have clinically
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant ascites, defined as ascites that is symptomatic or has resulted in a paracentesis in the past 3 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant ascites (palpable on exam, paracentesis in last 3 months, and/or symptomatic)?
